TopicTitle: KSP Wiki: merge infobox of stock and DLC

Articles.Content:
Currently, the system in the KSP wiki have the items of DLC straightly segeregated.

However, many DLC based games, such as BF1, put them right behind the items, with a bracket indicating which DLC they are from. See https://battlefield.fandom.com/wiki/Template:Weapons/BF1 as an example

With the second DLC, I propose we do likewise with the KSP wiki.

(Put it here as the wiki seems to be an official page, with the associated T2 agreement required)

Edited May 6, 2019 by Jestersage
Moving to Kerbal Network, since this is about the wiki rather than the game itself.

Did the Wiki ever get fixed? Last I heard people couldn't create accounts and I considered it a dead platform since only older members could edit/approve edits which greatly limited the ability to keep the wiki updated.

On 5/6/2019 at 4:46 PM, ZooNamedGames said:

Did the Wiki ever get fixed? Last I heard people couldn't create accounts and I considered it a dead platform since only older members could edit/approve edits which greatly limited the ability to keep the wiki updated.﻿

Maybe not. However, for those with existing Account, they can still edit it. And it's better than nothing.

Just now, Jestersage said:

Maybe not. However, for those with existing Account, they can still edit it. And it's better than nothing.

Or Squad could just get a new host site. I mean Fandom isn't great either but at least signing up isn't an issue.
